Author: Rodrigo Zechin Rosauro 
http://droidwall.googlecode.com 
 
Droid Wall - Android Firewall is a front-end application for the powerful iptables Linux firewall. It allows you to restrict which applications are permitted to access your cellular data network (GPRS/3G). 
This is the perfect solution if you don't have an unlimited data plan, or just wants to see your battery lasting longer. 
Using Droid Wall: 
Mark the applications that are ALLOWED to use GPRS/3G then click on Apply rules. 
Important: unmarked applications will not be able to access your data plan, but they will still be able to access Wi-fi. 
 
Click on Show rules to display current iptables rules output. 
 
Click on Purge rules to remove any iptables rules TEMPORARILY (until the next Apply rules or reboot). 
 
Password lock: 
You can set a password lock for Droid Wall by using the Set password menu option. To remove the password protection, just reset it to blank.
